steps.title: Insert the MS DOS Setup #1 floppy disk with the computer switched off.
steps.content: Insert the MS DOS Setup #1 floppy disk with the computer switched off .

steps.title: Start up the computer.
steps.content: Start up the computer.

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Select Configure unallocated disk space if your hard drive is unallocated.
steps.content: Select Configure unallocated disk space if your hard drive is unallocated. Press ↵ Enter . If you do have an allocated hard drive, select that partition and press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Ensure the setup floppy disk is inserted and press ↵ Enter to continue.
steps.content: Ensure the setup floppy disk is inserted and press ↵ Enter to continue.

steps.title: Check that the following settings are correct before pressing ↵ Enter to continue.
steps.content: Check that the following settings are correct before pressing ↵ Enter to continue.

steps.title: Choose a directory to install MS-DOS.
steps.content: Choose a directory to install MS-DOS. It is recommended to leave the directory where the computer recommends.

steps.title: Remove the Setup #1 floppy disk and insert the Setup #2 floppy disk and press ↵ Enter to continue.
steps.content: Remove the Setup #1 floppy disk and insert the Setup #2 floppy disk and press ↵ Enter to continue.

steps.title: Remove the Setup #2 floppy disk and insert the Setup #3 floppy disk and press ↵ Enter to continue.
steps.content: Remove the Setup #2 floppy disk and insert the Setup #3 floppy disk and press ↵ Enter to continue.

steps.title: Remove all floppy disks and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Remove all floppy disks and press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Restart your computer by pressing ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Restart your computer by pressing ↵ Enter .

steps.title: When you see this screen, insert the Windows 3.1 setup floppy.
steps.content: When you see this screen, insert the Windows 3.1 setup floppy.

steps.title: Type A and :.
steps.content: Type A and : . Then press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Type setup.
steps.content: Type setup . Then press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Pick your setup mode.
steps.content: Pick your setup mode. It's a matter of personal preference but for this tutorial, we will use the "Express Setup".

steps.title: Insert the "Microsoft Windows 3.1 Disk #2" floppy disk and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Insert the "Microsoft Windows 3.1 Disk #2" floppy disk and press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Insert the "Microsoft Windows 3.1 Disk #3" floppy disk and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Insert the "Microsoft Windows 3.1 Disk #3" floppy disk and press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Type in your name and press Continue.
steps.content: Type in your name and press Continue . You can type in your company if you wish but it isn't essential to the installation process.

steps.title: Check that your name and company correct and then click Continue.
steps.content: Check that your name and company correct and then click Continue . If you have made a mistake, click change and correct the mistake.

steps.title: Insert the "Microsoft Windows 3.1 Disk #4" floppy disk and click Continue.
steps.content: Insert the "Microsoft Windows 3.1 Disk #4" floppy disk and click Continue .

steps.title: Insert the "Microsoft Windows 3.1 Disk #5" floppy disk and click Continue.
steps.content: Insert the "Microsoft Windows 3.1 Disk #5" floppy disk and click Continue .

steps.title: Insert the "Microsoft Windows 3.1 Disk #6" floppy disk and click Continue.
steps.content: Insert the "Microsoft Windows 3.1 Disk #6" floppy disk and click Continue .

steps.title: If you wish to install a printer, click your desired printed and click Install.
steps.content: If you wish to install a printer, click your desired printed and click Install . For this tutorial, we will not be installing a printer so make sure "No Printer Attached" is highlighted and click install.

steps.title: If you see this message, do the following:
steps.content: If you see this message, do the following: Confirm that the message displays C:\DOS\EDIT.COM Make sure that "MS-DOS Editor" is highlighted Click OK .

steps.title: Use "Run tutorial" if you are used to newer operating systems.
steps.content: Use "Run tutorial" if you are used to newer operating systems. Windows 3.1 is very different (it doesn't have a Start menu)! For this article, "Skip Tutorial" was selected.

steps.title: Remove all floppy disks from the computer and click Reboot.
steps.content: Remove all floppy disks from the computer and click Reboot .

steps.title: Type in win and press ↵ Enter
steps.content: Type in win and press ↵ Enter

steps.title: If the setup has ran correctly, you will see this screen and Windows 3.1 is up and running to use.
steps.content: If the setup has ran correctly, you will see this screen and Windows 3.1 is up and running to use.

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File .

steps.title: Click Exit Windows.
steps.content: Click Exit Windows .

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK .

steps.title: When you see this screen, you are safe to turn your computer off via the button on the computer or to unplug it.
steps.content: When you see this screen, you are safe to turn your computer off via the button on the computer or to unplug it.
